verses.verse: Then came<WH935> David<WH1732> to Nob<WH5011> to Ahimelech<WH288> the priest.<WH3548> Ahimelech<WH288> came to meet<WH7125> David<WH1732> trembling,<WH2729> and said<WH559> to him,<WH376> "Why are you alone, and no man with you?"

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Ahimelech<WH288> the priest,<WH3548> "The king<WH4428> has commanded<WH6680> me a business,<WH1697> and has said<WH559> to me,<WH376> 'Let no man know<WH3045> anything<WH3972> of the business<WH1697> about which I send<WH7971> you,<WH6680> and what I have commanded you;<WH6680> and I have appointed the young men<WH5288> to such<WH6423> and such<WH492> a place.<WH4725>'
Now therefore what is<WH3426> under your hand?<WH3027> Give<WH5414> me five<WH2568> loaves of bread<WH3899> in my hand,<WH3027> or whatever there is present.<WH4672>"

The priest<WH3548> answered<WH6030> David,<WH1732> and said,<WH6030> "There is no common<WH2455> bread<WH3899> under my hand,<WH3027> but there is<WH3426> holy<WH6944> bread;<WH3899> if only the young men<WH5288> have kept<WH8104> themselves from<WH389> women.<WH802>"

David<WH1732> answered<WH6030> the priest,<WH3548> and said<WH6030> to him,<WH518> "Truly, women<WH802> have been kept<WH6113> from us about these three<WH8032> days.<WH8543> When I came out,<WH3318> the vessels<WH3627> of the young men<WH5288> were holy,<WH6944> though it was but a common<WH2455> journey.<WH1870> How much more then today<WH3117> shall their vessels<WH3627> be holy?<WH6942>"

So the priest<WH3548> gave<WH5414> him holy<WH6944> bread;<WH3899> for there was no bread there but the show bread,<WH3899> that was taken<WH5493> from before<WH6440> Yahweh,<WH3068> to put<WH7760> hot<WH2527> bread<WH3899> in the day<WH3117> when it was taken away.<WH3947>

Now a certain man<WH376> of the servants<WH5650> of Saul<WH7586> was there that day,<WH3117> detained<WH6113> before<WH6440> Yahweh;<WH3068> and his name<WH8034> was Doeg<WH1673> the Edomite,<WH130> the best<WH47> of the herdsmen<WH7462> who belonged to Saul.<WH7586>

David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Ahimelech,<WH288> "Isn't<WH371> there<WH3426> here under your hand<WH3027> spear<WH2595> or sword?<WH2719> For I have neither brought<WH3947> my sword<WH2719> nor my weapons<WH3627> with me,<WH3027> because the king<WH4428>'s business<WH1697> required<WH1961> haste.<WH5169>"

The priest<WH3548> said,<WH559> "The sword<WH2719> of Goliath<WH1555> the Philistine,<WH6430> whom you killed<WH5221> in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH425> behold,<WH3874> it is here wrapped in a cloth<WH8071> behind<WH310> the ephod.<WH646> If you will take<WH3947> that,<WH3947> take it;<WH312> for there is no other except<WH2108> that here.<WH2088>" David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "There is none like that.<WH5414> Give it to me."
David<WH1732> arose,<WH6965> and fled<WH1272> that day<WH3117> for fear<WH6440> of Saul,<WH7586> and went<WH935> to Achish<WH397> the king<WH4428> of Gath.<WH1661>

The servants<WH5650> of Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to him,<WH1732> "Isn't this David the king<WH4428> of the land?<WH776> Didn't<WH6030> they sing one to another about him<WH2088> in dances,<WH4246> saying,<WH559> <WH7586> 'Saul has slain<WH5221> his thousands,<WH505> David<WH1732> his ten thousands?<WH505>'"
David<WH1732> laid up<WH7760> these words<WH1697> in his heart,<WH3824> and was very<WH3966> afraid<WH3372> of<WH6440> Achish<WH397> the king<WH4428> of Gath.<WH1661>

He changed<WH8138> his behavior<WH2940> before<WH5869> them,<WH1984> and pretended to be mad in their hands,<WH3027> and scrabbled<WH8427> on the doors<WH1817> of the gate,<WH8179> and let his spittle<WH7388> fall down<WH3381> on his beard.<WH2206>
Then Achish<WH397> said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "Look,<WH7200> you see the man<WH376> is mad.<WH7696> Why then have you brought him to me?<WH935>
Do I lack<WH2638> madmen,<WH7696> that you have brought<WH935> this fellow to play the madman<WH7696> in my presence?<WH935> Shall this fellow come into my house?<WH1004>"
